body.name: Swim Diapers Size 4 (20-33 lb) - Pampers Splashers Disposable Swim Pants, Medium, Pack of 2 (Twinpack), 18 Count
features: Recommended Weight: 20 - 33 Pounds. Don't swell in water like regular diapers, for a comfortable fit when wet or dry
Dual Leak-Guard Barriers fit snugly around baby's legs to help contain messes
360˚ stretchy waistband provides an all-around stretchy fit that fits like swimwear
Easy-Tear Sides are designed to make removal quick and easy
NOTE: The expiration date is for REWARDS not for the product
body.description: Discontinued Item By Manufacturer, Please Do Not Order

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Active Baby Fit The correct size swim pant for your baby should conform to their body and allow them to move freely, while keeping its shape at the waist and between the legs. Find the Right Fit Start by using this chart to find the right fit for your baby. Babies come in all shapes and sizes. That’s why Splashers has multiple sizes and a stretchy waistband to fit every baby. Wearing and Changing Splashers are designed to be worn alone or under your baby’s favorite swimsuit. Easy-Tear Sides make it simple to remove when they need a change or are finished playing in the water.

Our Commitment Caring for babies is in our DNA. Our Pampers Bright Beginnings programs enable healthy development and early success for babies and families through education, hospital partnerships, and donations March of Dimes Partnership Pampers is proud to support the March of Dimes in giving every baby a fighting chance. We help provide our smallest diapers to the 1 million babies born before 28-week gestational age each year Sustainability Pampers cares for every baby and the planet they grow up in. We maintain zero manufacturing to landfill across all our plants and are committed to 100% renewable electricity by 2030 Community Donations Through ongoing donation efforts and partnerships with organizations like Feeding America and Matthew 25, Pampers strives to help babies get the bright beginnings they deserve Changing Table Access 9 out of 10 dads have used a public restroom that lacks a changing table. As part of our “Love the Change” campaign, we’re providing 5,000 changing tables for men’s restrooms across North America Hospital Support Proud to be the #1 choice of U.S. hospitals for nearly 50 years, we partner with nurses to develop skin-protecting products and support nursing education—all to help baby’s healthy development

Are these swim diapers safe for the beach? Yes! Splashers are perfect for the beach, pool or any water activity. Unlike regular diapers, Splashers don’t swell in water and have a 360° Gap-Free Fit waistband and Dual Leak-Guard Barriers to protect during play. How do you properly remove the diapers? To remove, just rip the Easy-Tear Sides and roll up the diaper to dispose. Are Splashers safe for my baby’s skin? Yes! Babies' health and safety are our priority at Pampers. To keep your baby’s skin healthy, Splashers are hypoallergenic—free of elemental chlorine bleaching, parabens and latex. Are Splashers designed for boys or girls? Splashers are designed to be gender-neutral for both boys and girls to use. They also feature swimwear-style graphics with cute beach characters. How far in advance of swimming should I put these on my baby? Because the diapers are specially designed to contain a mess while swimming and not be big and bulky like a traditional diaper, you will have the best experience if you put these on right before your child is ready to go swimming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great fun for my grandkids!
reviews.reviewText: This pool was great for my 18 mo., 3 yr. and 11yr. Old. The 3 yr. old was the most “abusive”. She did everything with gusto and jumped and splashed and pulled on everything.I was impressed at the pool’s durability. I originally used a car air compressor to blow it up and then bought an electric air pump as a precaution thinking I would have to keep inflating. But I did not need it. It was used two months with no problems. The sprinkler was a big hit with all three.The Candy Zone pool was placed on a patio under a deck on a mat so sun really did not hit it. I liked the two drainage holes but needs to have bottom raised to let water drain out. I will look into getting a couple short pieces of hose or tubing to drain next year. I pd.$88 which I thought was too much. But since we were Covid home bound figure that was a bargain for so much fun outdoor entertainment for three kids. Really happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great SWIM diaper
reviews.reviewText: These diapers fit well, do their job, and my baby seems comfortable in them.I never put them on until we are at the pool and ready to swim. It will not stop all urine from leaking around the legs. It’s made to not swell in water (aka they don’t absorb very much liquid) and to keep solid waste from making its way into the pool water.These diapers will be our go to for the rest of summer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2018
reviews.reviewText: These are so much better than the Huggies brand. I found that the huggies brand do not hold any liquid in at all which I understand to a point because they are made for swimming but it would be frustrating if we put them on and my son would pee before we got to the pool because the pee would just run down his leg all over the place. The Pampers brand however does hold a bit of urine in them. The pampers brand also hold up a lot better than other brands I’ve used, other brands tend to rip easily as you pull them on where these don’t. I love these and will continue to purchase these and recommend them to everyone I know with little ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Muy lindas y de buena calidad

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For only a small pack of swim diapers the cost is outrageous when it arrived i was in shock i paid 40 for 21 diapers havent opened but any otger parent who has a toddler who is over 40 pounds hunting for swim diapers that fit due to toddler not being potty trained yet has to take the price these should be $15 the most i will come back amd edit if they run too small

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2017
reviews.reviewText: My 2 yr old loves to go to the lake or pool. She loves to get these and put them on herself. She is ~25 lbs, and these fit just right. Keep the #2 in them if it happens while she is in the pool. Worth the premium price for the comfort and quality vs store brands. Recommend to all parents of water-loving little ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No Wee in the Water, Baby!
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for you waterbaby! These are easy to pull on and tear off. They are just absorbent enough to last for a brief session in the water. We use our for weekly swim classes. Don't count on these for full absorbency - they don't hold that much and aren't thickly lined. If you're planning a day at the pool or on the beach make sure you're prepared for multiple changes. These aren't going to last long. They do the job for short duration pool excursions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Do what they're supposed to do
reviews.reviewText: These definitely hold in what needs to be held in. I found that out the hard way when I dried off my son then pulled the diaper down on a rug! Water everywhere! But showed me that they do hold stuff in! When we actually needed it to work for poop, it did well. Yes, it's wet and gross and messy, but you're swimming in poop, so what do you expect? Ha.

reviews.reviewTitle: no me gustó, no retiene la orina
reviews.reviewText: esperaba más de estos pañales, no se inflan como los de la competencia, la orina se sale del pañal, son cómodos para los bebés y vienen de acuerdo a la talla que indican, tampoco me gustó que vinieran en paquete de 3 bolsas

Excelentes pañales para la alberca incluso mejor que la marca huggies swimmers! Es más fácil ponerlos ya que se usan como ropa interior común y los de otras marcas hay que ajustarlos con Velcro que a veces no pega bien.

Somos fan de pampers, hemos probado otras marcas, pero nos acoplamos a esta, les resultan cómodos, resistentes, la marca de pipí , sueles ser funcional. Jamas hemos tenido problemas de alergias o algo así.

Padrísimos y de excelente calidad, mi hijo tiene 2 años y está súper grande y estos pañales le quedaron a la perfección. Espero estén disponibles pronto ya que se me está terminando y no los encuentro por ningún lado.
Great price and great product. Amazing during swimming no leaks. My little one doesn't seem to mind them
